channel.title: BBC News - England
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Streatham terror attack: Prison recall may have stopped Sudesh Amman
item.description: Sudesh Amman could have been stopped from stabbing two people in south London, an inquest finds.

item.title: Plymouth shooting: Jake Davison given gun licence for sporting purposes
item.description: Jake Davison was issued his firearms licence for clay pigeon shooting, police chief reveals.

item.title: Afghan boy death: MPs call for urgent investigation after hotel fall
item.description: A group of MPs backs calls for the government to review the safety of accommodation for Afghan refugees.

item.title: World War Two Wren, 101, releases London memoir
item.description: Christian Lamb describes her war work as "very, very exciting but very, very secret".

item.title: Record number of bids for UK City of Culture 2025
item.description: For the first time groups of towns or areas have been able to bid for the cultural capital title.

item.title: Bristol mum facing £85k bill to extend life with her son
item.description: Sarah hopes specialist treatment in Germany will enable her to see her son through to his GCSEs.

item.title: Red phone box dug up and stolen from village garden
item.description: Three men used a digger to steal the phone box, belonging to Chelford Parish Council, police say.

item.title: Warehouse destroyed in huge fire
item.description: Deodorants stored at the site explode, "popping right through the night", the fire service says.

item.title: Ed Sheeran's 'Castle on the Hill': Repairs begin on Framlingham Castle
item.description: Vegetation will be cleared and mortar joints repointed on the castle that inspired the famous song.

item.title: Students 'devastated' after losing Leeds college places
item.description: Notre Dame College in Leeds is criticised for telling pupils by text the night before enrolment.

item.title: Geronimo the alpaca legal fight cost £43k plus lost income
item.description: Helen Macdonald says apart from legal costs her farm has been deprived of income for four years.

item.title: Injured Dubai cat flown to Bradford rescue centre
item.description: The cat was ‘left for dead’ until the centre paid for the transport to West Yorkshire.

item.title: 'I thought I can make a difference'
item.description: A Hull hairdresser who lost his own hair due to cancer is now making wigs to help others.

item.title: Cumbria kidney swap couple recovering after surgery
item.description: The couple joined a national kidney sharing scheme to boost Fiona's chances of finding a donor.

item.title: Plasma donor meets children helped by donations
item.description: A donor from Coventry meets a family from Nottingham whose children who were saved by plasma.

item.title: Pub car park 'rifle' arrest caught on film
item.description: Bodycam footage shows the response of armed police to reports of a man making threats with a rifle.

item.title: Hartpury says unvaccinated students cannot live on-site
item.description: Students without the Covid-19 jab may also have their access to social clubs and venues restricted.

item.title: Covid: Nottingham's Goose Fair called off for second year running
item.description: A council says the cancellation is due to "ongoing concerns and uncertainty" about Covid.

item.title: Maldon councillors accused of Pride flag 'homophobia'
item.description: The Rev Tony Shrimpton and others are accused of making "blatant homophobic" remarks.

item.title: Mid Sussex Marlins: Senior swim team set new world record
item.description: The quartet has a combined age of 280, and beat the previous world best in their age category.

item.title: Science teacher made pupil send sexual selfies
item.description: Josh Larcombe has been given a suspended jail sentence at Plymouth Crown Court.

item.title: Arsenal boss Mikel Arteta surprised Brentford game was played following Covid cases
item.description: Arsenal boss Mikel Arteta says he was surprised the Gunners' Premier League opener with Brentford went ahead after a number of coronavirus cases at the club.

item.title: Rob Burrow: Leeds Rhinos assistant Jamie Jones-Buchanan says former favourite still inspires
item.description: Rob Burrow continues to inspire the new generation of Leeds Rhinos players, says assistant coach Jamie Jones-Buchanan.

item.title: Leicester Tigers: Premiership club join forces with Lichfield to form women's team
item.description: Leicester Tigers and Lichfield have launched a women's team and are set to apply for a Premier 15s license.
